topic.title: HPE Helion OpenStack 1.1: Add a Disk to a Scale-out Object Ring

body.p: Perform the following procedure to add a disk to a scale-out object ring.

ul.li:
HPE Helion OpenStack cloud is successfully deployed.
(Starter Object Storage (Swift) nodes are functional by default as they are part of cloud deployment.)
All of the rings generated must be preserved, preferably at more than one location. Swift needs these rings to be consistent across all nodes.
Take a backup of the rings before any operation.

section.title: Add Disks to a Scale-out Ring
section.p: Perform the following steps to add disk to a Swift ring:

ol.li: Log in to the undercloud from seed.# ssh heat-admin@<Undercloud IP address> # sudo -i
Change the directory to ring builder.# cd /root/ring-building
List the disks on a node.# ringos list-disks -n <Object nodes IP address>

Format a given disk.# ringos format-disks -n <Object nodes IP address> -d <disk>
You can format all the disks with a single command (-d --all).
List the files in the ring building directory and identify theobject-1.builder file.

Add a formatted disk to object-1 ring.# ringos add-disk-to-ring -f /root/ring-building/object-1.builder -i <Object nodes IP address> -p <port> -d <disk label> -w <weight> -r <region> -z <zone>
Recommendation: Add drives gradually using a weighted approach to avoid degraded performance of the Swift cluster. The weight will gradually increase by 25% until it reaches 100%. The initial weight is 25.

Re-balance the object-1 ring.# ringos rebalance-ring -f /root/ring-building/object-1.builder
You must wait for the time specified by min_part_hours before another re-balance succeeds.
List all the Swift nodes.# ringos list-swift-nodes -t all
Copy object-1.ring.gz file to all the nodes.# ringos copy-ring -s /root/ring-building/object-1.ring.gz -n <Swift nodes IP address>

Copy object-1.builder file to all the nodes.# ringos copy-ring -s /root/ring-building/object-1.builder -n <Swift nodes IP address>
The .buldier and .ring.gz files must be present in the Swift nodes.
You can also copy the ring files and the builder files to all the swift nodes using the following commands:# ringos copy-ring -s /root/ring-building/\*.ring.gz -n all
# ringos copy-ring -s /root/ring-building/object-1.builder -n all
Set the weight of the disks using the following command:# ringos set-weight -f /root/ring-building/object-1.builder -s <disk-id> -w <weight>
Repeat steps from 7-11 increasing the weight by 25 each time; set the weight to 50, 75, and finally 100 (w= 50, 75, 100) .
